title: A path integration approach to relativistic finite density problems and its particle content
abstract: A path integration formulation for the finite density and temperature problems is shown to be consistent with the thermodynamics using an 8 component ``real'' representation for the fermion fields by applying it to a free fermion system. A relativistic quantum field theory is shown to be smoothly approached at zero temperature by a real-time thermal field theory so derived even at a finite density. The analysis leads to a new representation for the fermion fields which is shown to be inequivalent to the conventional 4 component theory at the quantum level by having a mirror universe with observable effects and to be better behaved at short distances.
